title: Scope Chrome extension implementation from PR #172 proposal
description:
Based on the Chrome extension proposal in PR #172, break down the implementation into discrete tasks.

## Background
PR #172 proposes a minimal Chrome extension (~100 LOC) using:
- TypeScript with Manifest V3
- Server-side extraction (reuse existing ExtractsArticle service)
- Monorepo structure (browser_extension/ directory)
- Bearer token authentication
- Context menu + icon-click triggers
- Toast notifications for feedback

## Scoping Areas to Define

### Backend Changes
- API tokens table for authentication
- New API endpoint for extension submissions
- CORS configuration
- Rate limiting

### Extension Implementation
- Manifest V3 setup
- TypeScript build pipeline
- Authentication flow (token storage)
- UI components (popup, context menu, toasts)

### Testing Strategy
- Jest unit tests for extension
- Rails integration tests for API endpoint
- Manual testing checklist

### Deployment
- Chrome Web Store submission process
- Firefox Add-ons path
- GitHub Actions automation

## Deliverable
A set of beads tasks with dependencies that can be executed to build the Chrome extension feature.
